column1: Compazine is a drug used to treat severe nausea and vomiting.
Prochlorperazine is the poisonous ingredient in Compazine.

BLADDER AND KIDNEYS - Unable to completely empty the bladder EYES, EARS, NOSE, MOUTH, AND THROAT - Blurred vision - Drooling - Dry mouth - Nasal congestion - Small pupils - Yellow eyes STOMACH AND INTESTINES - Constipation - Loss of appetite - Nausea - Swallowing problems HEART AND BLOOD - Low blood pressure (severe) - Pounding heartbeat - Rapid heartbeat MUSCLES AND JOINTS - Muscle spasms - Stiff muscles in neck, face, or back NERVOUS SYSTEM - Coma (decreased level of consciousness and lack of responsiveness) - Convulsions (seizures) - Disorientation - Drowsiness - Fever - Motor tics that the person cannot control - Low body temperature - Restlessness linked with repeated foot shuffling, rocking, or pacing - Tremor - Uncoordinated movement, slow movement, or shuffling (with long-term use or overuse) - Weakness REPRODUCTIVE SYSTEM - Changes in menstrual patterns SKIN - Rash - Yellow skin Some of these symptoms may occur even when the medicine is taken properly.
